subject: JUnit tests in plain English
msgSnippet: I ve released a new testing tool called Concordion that lets you write tests in plain English. Well kinda. In HTML. Take a look at:  http://www.concordion.org/
messageBody:
I've released a new testing tool called Concordion that lets you write
tests in plain English. Well kinda. In HTML.

Take a look at: http://www.concordion.org/

Readable JUnit tests are difficult to write. You can put a description
of the behaviour in the name of the test method. E.g.
testStrikeDefaultsToSpotPrice()
But the internals of the method still tend to be a mess of test data
and plumbing code.

This is where Concordion steps in...

Basically the tool lets you write a requirement specification in plain
English and then turn it into an automated JUnit test. It separates
test data and the plumbing code.

Please try it out. The tutorial takes about 5-30 mins (depending on
how fast you type). The software is new and may have some rough edges,
but I would really like some feedback about the idea, and gather
suggestions for future enhancements etc.

David
